messages: 94ece629302b8d297aacee2baaf20ac0 (18:46): "Solaris 10 OS, x86, for downloading onto WINDOWS ONLY Platform - Solaris 10 6/06 Operating System"
94ece629302b8d297aacee2baaf20ac0 (18:46): wtf?
e55e49dbdc0b3b324ddec7711f265523 (18:46): the first are .exe  ..
d29f7858616789349f2e17f17eaa3395 (18:46): could be auto extractor...
9f68ab96646717c9ac631f53a3130c5a (18:46): you want the other one :)
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (18:51): I have a "soft ray" client which I'm using to type this. I have a some strangeness with keyboard....
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (18:52): I'm using a UK keyboard, when I press the ¬£ (sterling) key it comes out as a ¬£ on thunderbird, xev sees it as a sterling but....
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (18:53): xterm sees is as a # - as if it is a US keyboard. Sounds like a config problem, can anyone point me in the right direction
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (18:53): I obviously want to see a ¬£ on the xterm (gnome-term does the same)... Thanks
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (18:53): Out of random interest (I don't know the answer), what happens with the other keys that differ between the two? :)
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (18:54): They give UK mappings on thunderbird etc, US mappings on xterm
9f68ab96646717c9ac631f53a3130c5a (18:54): you might want to check out the keyboardDialect option to xterm
94ece629302b8d297aacee2baaf20ac0 (18:55): im pretty sure that i would need the exe to unpack :)
70422b2adf851815bd354aadfc8d08dc (18:56): hm, initializing a disk (slicing, partitioning, dumping a filesystem on it) was easier than I thought from the commandline :P
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (18:56): is keyboardDialect an X resource?
9f68ab96646717c9ac631f53a3130c5a (18:58): yeah, but actually I think I was wrong there (I just searched the manpage for "character set")...
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (18:58): I was going to wonder whether it was the JDS/gnome keyboard switcher's incredibly irritating ability to make layouts window-specific.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (18:58): but since the switcher outright doesn't work, that's pretty unlikely, huh? :)

9f68ab96646717c9ac631f53a3130c5a (19:01): there's actually a big section on locales in the xterm manpage which suggests it uses luit to convert between the X locale and the locale for what's running in the window

e166e2eaa2a260067d530b91de396ddb (19:01): Who is responsible for the http://www.opensolaris.org/os/downloads/on/ page? The Solaris Express download link refers to b44, but 46 is recent as far as http://www.opensolaris.org/os/community/onnv/ tells
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (19:01): PerterB: it doesn't sound like a locale thing.
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (19:01): PerterB: it sounds like having two different keyboard layouts at once, somehow.
9f68ab96646717c9ac631f53a3130c5a (19:02): nah, if that were the case things like @ and " would be wrong too
9f68ab96646717c9ac631f53a3130c5a (19:02): (they're also in a different place on UK keyboards)
9f68ab96646717c9ac631f53a3130c5a (19:03): quick test, run xterm -u8 and it should pass UTF-8 through to the running program, and see if you still get a #
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (19:10): they are
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (19:13): my xterm doesn't recognise -u8
9f68ab96646717c9ac631f53a3130c5a (19:15): oh bugger, I didn't realise I had been logged out of my solaris box... I was reading the freebsd xterm manpage
571055a4bff9fb6ea675d38374df3460 (19:16): PROMPT="<SOLARIS> %# "
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (19:23): export LC_ALL=iso_8859_1
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (19:23): then when xterm starts get:
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (19:23): Warning: locale not supported by C library, locale unchanged
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (19:23): but then I get my ¬£
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (19:27): ... now I'm even more puzzled
6f2f12da49916f464f2be3349ae6e3f4 (19:27): me too.. and unset LC_ALL gives same warning but doesn't work!
70422b2adf851815bd354aadfc8d08dc (19:43): grrr, lucreate won't let me create a boot env :(
70422b2adf851815bd354aadfc8d08dc (19:44): I'm trying this: lucreate -c "solenv1" -m /:/dev/dsk/c0d1s0:ufs -n "solenv2"
70422b2adf851815bd354aadfc8d08dc (19:44): oh nvm
